title: Introduction to Newton's Laws
content: Newton's Laws form the foundation of classical mechanics and describe the relationship between motion and forces.

title: Force Diagram
content:
graph TD
    A[Object at Rest] -->|Force Applied| B[Object in Motion]
    B -->|Friction/Resistance| C[Slowing Down]
    C -->|No Net Force| A
    style A fill:#e1f5ff
    style B fill:#fff4e1
    style C fill:#ffe1e1

title: Key Concepts
content: The three laws describe: 1) Inertia - objects resist changes in motion, 2) F=ma - force equals mass times acceleration, 3) Action-Reaction - forces come in pairs.

title: Newton's Laws Timeline
content:
timeline
    title Development of Newton's Laws
    1665 : Plague year - Newton develops early ideas
    1687 : Publishes Principia Mathematica
    1700s : Laws applied to astronomy and engineering
    1900s : Relativity provides corrections for high speeds
